ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Increased both listening, speaking, reading and writing skills for Korean in this semester.
Korean speaking, knowledge of Korean culture, and Korean food!
Korean vocabulary, cultural perspective provided by discussions and the drama we watched.
Advanced grammar structures, advanced and specialized vocabulary, conversation and debate skills, cultural and historic enrichment. Very good class!

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Very fun, informative course! It was very enjoyable.

I wish the class was more structured around grammar, and learning to speak using different grammatical forms. Even though there were lots of advanced learners in the class, I think we would have all found it helpful. Loved the friendly atmosphere of the class - looked forward to coming each day.

It was difficult to learn the vocab before reading our lesson materials because vocab, especially highly specialized vocab, has nuances for specific usage, which we would not know until we knew the context for the lessons. That was one weakness. Another weakness was disorganization, though it was never bad. I wish schedules would be finalized on a specific day (Sat, Sun, etc) so we would know when to check in order to plan our week accordingly. Knowing an assignment two days before its due date made it difficult to balance course workload with my other courses. A strength was the intimacy with our class and our professor, which became stronger as we worked on group projects and had lunches together throughout the semester.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Totally recommend this course as long as you have the level of language proficiency.

If you think you can take this course, you should. I started in L1/L2, went on Light for a summer, came back for L3/L4 heritage then took KREN 152. It was very challenging, and I was significantly below the average level of students, but Professor Lee-Smith is amazing and I learned a lot.
YES! It was a wonderful course with a wonderful instructor. Professor Lee-Smith is an amazing professor and great instructor! Must take.
Yes, I would recommend this course to another student.
